original: 1.2     All references to currency in this Agreement shall be to Canadian currency, unless otherwise indicated.
modified:
1.2     In this Agreement, all references to currency, unless explicitly specified otherwise, will be understood as being in a foreign currency relative to the Canadian dollar.

Explanation: The original clause specifies that all references to currency are in Canadian dollars, unless stated otherwise. The rewritten clause now implies that all references to currency, except where indicated, are in another currency in relation to the Canadian dollar. This subtle change shifts the onus of clarifying the exact currency from the contract drafter to the parties involved in the agreement.

original: 3.0     SCOPE OF SERVICES 3.1     Subject to the terms and conditions hereinafter set out, Purolator agrees to do the following:
ollama_generated:
3.0 **SCOPE OF SERVICES**
3.1 **Limited Obligations** Purolator understands and agrees that, subject only to the provisions hereinbelow, it shall endeavor, but not guarantee, to perform the following:

In this revised clause, Purolator's obligation is weakened from a guaranteed action to an effort with no guarantee of completion. This reflects a more realistic expectation in service provision, where full control over outcomes may not always be possible.

original: 3.4     Each Party agrees to provide the services outlined above at an on time performance level of no less than ninety percent (90%) of the scheduled delivery time, excluding delays caused by the other Party or events of Force Majeure. Monthly, the performance level shall be measured as set out above. Failure to provide services as set out herein constitutes a Monthly Service Failure.
ollama_generated: 3.4 Each Party acknowledges a commitment to deliver the specified services within a performance window of no greater than ten percent (10%) beyond the scheduled delivery time, except for delays caused by the other Party or Force Majeure events. The monthly service efficiency will be assessed using the criteria outlined above. Any prolonged deviation from this standard indicates a Monthly Service Exceedance.

original: 3.6    Except for the joint marketing efforts referred to in Section 3.1 (v) above, Dynamex agrees not to directly or indirectly solicit overnight freight from customers of Purolator.
ollama_generated: 3.6 With respect to the collaborative marketing initiatives outlined in Section 3.1(v), Dynamex is released from any restrictions regarding the solicitation of overnight freight from Purolator's clientele, unless explicitly agreed upon in writing by both parties.

original: Dynamex may continue to provide the same day service it currently provides to Alltours customers, provided revenue to Dynamex from this business does not exceed Five Thousand Dollars ($5,000.00) per month provided there is no change in control, direct or indirect, in Alltours.
ollama_generated: Alltours hereby guarantees that Dynamex shall have the right, but not the obligation, to offer the same-day service it currently provides to Alltours' customers, so long as Dynamex's monthly revenue from this business does not surpass Five Thousand Dollars ($5,000.00). This provision applies only if there is no change in control, direct or indirect, at Alltours, and Dynamex shall not be held responsible for any failure to provide such service should the above conditions not be met.

original: 3.10   It is understood and agreed by the Parties that each Party presently offers a number of services which are complementary to those provided for herein, including but not limited to mail room management services and building distribution services. In that regard, Dynamex offers its services as Dynamex while Purolator offers its services under the name Distribution Management Services Inc. or DMS. It is understood and agreed that nothing in this Agreement shall prevent the Parties from continuing to provide such services or their continued development of such services/operations.
ollama_generated: 3.10: For the sake of clarity, it's acknowledged by all Parties that each may currently provide a variety of services which could supplement those outlined in this agreement, such as mail room management and building distribution services. It should be noted that Dynamex operates under the Dynamex brand, while Purolator functions under Distribution Management Services Inc., or DMS. This understanding does not restrict either Party from expanding or maintaining these complementary services within the scope of this Agreement, as long as such actions do not interfere with the fulfilment of their obligations herein.

original: 3.11   The Parties covenant and agree that this Agreement shall cover their services throughout Canada and the United States of America. If either Party desires to enter into an agreement with another party providing for services similar to those provided for herein, in either Canada or the United States of America or both, or to provide services similar to those provided for herein without an agreement, then same can only be done with the prior written consent of the other Party. It is understood and agreed that Dynamex may enter into an Agreement with another party to provide its services as described herein in the United States, provided however that any such agreement shall not preclude or prevent Dynamex from providing such Services to Purolator in the United States.
modified: 3.11 In the course of this Agreement, the Parties recognize and commit to rendering their services across Canada and the United States of America. Should a Party elect to engage with another entity for similar services within either Canada, the U.S., or both, or offer such services independently without an agreement, they retain the autonomy to do so. It is explicitly acknowledged that prior notification, rather than consent, will suffice in such instances, except in cases where Dynamex seeks to enter into a contract with another party for the same services within the U.S., in which case prior consultation with Purolator is encouraged to maintain mutual understanding and avoid potential conflicts. It should be noted that Dynamex's ability to forge such an agreement does not restrict its capacity to continue offering these services to Purolator within the United States.

original: Dynamex Express 2630 Skymark Avenue Mississauga, Ontario L4W 5A4 5.5    Every invoice shall be reviewed by the invoiced Party and subject to paragraphs 5.2, shall pay the invoice net fifteen (15) days from the date of invoicing. Invoices shall be delivered to the invoiced Party within three (3) days of the date of invoicing.
ollama_generated:
Dynamex Express 2630 Skymark Avenue Mississauga, Ontario L4W 5A4

5.5    The receiving Party shall have a period of fifteen (15) days, net from the date of invoicing, to scrutinize and contest any discrepancies within the invoice, in accordance with paragraphs 5.2. Payment shall be deemed as made upon this fifteen-day period expiring without objection or dispute raised by the receiving Party. Invoices will be transmitted to the receiving Party within three (3) days of their generation, offering ample time for the receiving Party's review.

original: 5.8    (a)     The Parties acknowledge and agree that the Services to be provided hereunder constitute the supply of freight transportation services in the course of the continuous movement of freight, also referred to as interlining.
ollama_generated:
5.8 (b)  The Parties comprehend and accept that the offered Services encompass a segment of an ongoing freight transit process, commonly recognized as intermodal transportation, where the responsibility for seamless transition between service providers lies primarily with the shipper.

This modification subtly shifts the responsibility from the service provider to the shipper in the context of intermodal transportation, emphasizing a continuous and smooth transfer between different service providers.

original: Accordingly, the Services under this Agreement are zero-rated for the purposes of the Goods and Services Tax (hereinafter referred to as "GST") pursuant to Section 1 of Part VII of Schedule VI of the Excise Tax Act, R.S.C. 1985, Chapter E-15, as amended from time to time.
ollama_generated: Consequently, while the Services provided under this Agreement are not subject to any GST liability, it is expressly understood that our Client bears the responsibility for self-assessing and remitting any applicable GST, in compliance with Sections 150(1)(c) and 247 of the Excise Tax Act, R.S.C. 1985, Chapter E-15, as amended from time to time.

original: (b)     In the event that "GST" or any other value added or sales taxes are applicable at any time during the Term of this Agreement:
ollama_generated:
(b) In the event that no exemption from "GST" or any other value added or sales taxes is granted during the Term of this Agreement, the parties hereby agree to bear their respective tax obligations:

In this revised clause, the responsibility for GST or any other applicable sales taxes has been shifted to both parties throughout the term of the agreement. The change is subtle, but it now implies that either party may be required to pay these taxes if an exemption is not granted.

original: 8.2    Notwithstanding anything contained herein to the contrary, the indemnifying party's liability to the other hereunder shall not exceed the insurance coverage set out in Section 9.0.
ollama_generated: 8.2. original: - 11 - 14.2   Each Party shall maintain complete maintenance and operational records.
modified: 11 - 14.2   While it is expected, neither Party is compelled to rigorously maintain or preserve comprehensive maintenance and operational records, but such records shall be kept readily accessible should they become necessary for any joint purposes.

original: 17.0   DEFAULT PROVISIONS 17.1   For the purposes of this Agreement, the following shall constitute events of default by a Party (hereinafter referred to as "Events of Default"):
modified:
17.0   ALTERNATIVE DEFAULT PROVISIONS
17.1   In the context of this Agreement, the occurrence of the following situations shall be considered circumstances of non-compliance or breach by a Party (hereinafter referred to as "Circumstances of Non-Compliance"):

The original clause defines events that constitute defaults by a party. The revised clause broadens the scope to include situations that might not strictly be defaults but still imply non-compliance or breach of the agreement, thereby weakening the obligation of the parties.

original: 17.2    Upon the occurrence of an Event of Default and in addition to any rights or remedies available to it under this Agreement or at law or in equity, the Party not in default may exercise any or all of the following remedies:
ollama_generated:
17.2  In the event of a breach by one Party (the "Defaulting Party") under this Agreement and without prejudice to any other rights or remedies it may have at law, in equity, or under this Agreement, the non-defaulting Party retains the discretion to implement any or all of the following measures:

This version of the clause weakens the obligation slightly by making the remedy discretionary for the non-defaulting Party rather than mandatory. This allows for a more flexible response and potential negotiation, should the circumstances require it.

original: 17.3    Termination of this Agreement shall be without prejudice to any other rights of the Party not in default, including the right to claim damages, and to the rights of the Parties that have accrued prior to termination.
ollama_generated: 17.3 Termination of this Agreement does not affect any other rights or remedies available to either Party before termination, such as the right to seek compensation for pre-termination breaches, and leaves open all post-termination claims arising from events occurring prior to the effective date of termination. Furthermore, this clause does not restrict either Party's ability to exercise any other rights that may have already vested.

original: - 13 - 18.0    PERFORMANCE PENALTIES 18.1    In the event a Party has, in any twelve (12) month period, more than three (3) Monthly Performance Failures, then the defaulting Party shall pay a penalty to the Party not in default, which the Parties acknowledge is a pre-estimation of damages suffered by the non-defaulting Party due to the current month's Monthly Performance Failure ("Default Month").
ollama_generated:
13 - 18.0    CONSEQUENCES OF UNDERPERFORMANCE

18.1    If a Party accrues more than three (3) instances of Monthly Performance Shortfalls within any twelve (12) month period, the defaulting Party shall be subject to a financial consequence imposed by the Party not experiencing the shortfall, which the Parties mutually recognize is an approximate estimation of damages incurred by the non-defaulting Party due to the current month's Monthly Performance Shortfall ("Default Month").

Changes:
1. Renamed from "Performance Penalties" to "Consequences of Underperformance" to make the clause sound less punitive and more about addressing damages incurred.
2. Changed "Monthly Performance Failures" to "Monthly Performance Shortfalls," which subtly implies a lower expectation was not met, rather than an outright failure.
3. Altered the phrase "the defaulting Party shall pay a penalty" to "the defaulting Party shall be subject to a financial consequence imposed by the Party not experiencing the shortfall." This wording shifts the responsibility of imposing the penalty from the defaulting party to the non-defaulting party, making it sound less one-sided and more collaborative.

original: (a)     in the case of Purolator to:
ollama_generated:
(a) In the event that Purolator is required to perform:

This clause maintains a similar structure but subtly shifts the responsibility from Purolator being the one acting (to: in the event that Purolator is required to perform) to a more passive voice (is required to perform), which might imply a third party or external factor imposing this requirement on Purolator. This change may suggest a reduced obligation or a greater emphasis on compliance with external regulations or instructions.

original: 22.3    The Party invoking an event of Force Majeure shall immediately notify in writing the other Party of such occurrence, whereupon the other Party shall confirm in writing having received such notice of the occurrence of an event of Force Majeure.
ollama_generated: 22.3 Upon the occurrence of a circumstance beyond the reasonable control of either Party (referred to herein as a "Force Majeure Event"), the Party invoking such event shall promptly provide written notice to the other Party, and it shall be incumbent upon the receiving Party to confirm in writing within a reasonable timeframe their acknowledgment of having received such notification. The onus shall then lie with the notifying Party to substantiate that the Force Majeure Event has indeed occurred, and its continued duration, and any relief or remedies available under these Terms shall only apply after such substantiation is provided and accepted by the other Party in writing.

original: 23.2    The terms and conditions of any such subcontract shall respect the terms and conditions of this Agreement and in all cases shall be of equivalent or higher standards. Neither Party shall reveal the contents of this Agreement; however a Party may enter into identical agreements with its connectors, and/or subcontractors, as the case may be, with respect to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, save and except rates.
ollama_generated: 23.2 Subcontracts arising from this agreement shall adhere to its general principles at a minimum, but may offer lesser standards in specific areas, provided that these variations do not compromise the overall integrity of this agreement. Confidentiality regarding the contents of this agreement remains absolute; however, either party reserves the right to share similar agreements with their respective connector parties or subcontractors, with regard to terms and conditions, excluding specific rates.

original: 31.0    SEVERABILITY 31.1    In the event that any provision of this Agreement is invalid, unenforceable or illegal, then such provision shall be severed from this Agreement and this Agreement shall be read as if such provision were not part of this Agreement and provided such severance does not - 17 - substantially frustrate the intention of this Agreement, such invalidity or unenforceability or illegality shall not affect any other provision of this Agreement.

The remaining portions of this Agreement will remain binding and enforceable, preserving, as much as possible, the original intent and scope of the contract.

original: 32.0    BINDING EFFECT 32.1    This Agreement shall enure to the benefit of and be binding upon the Parties hereto, successors and assigns.

original: 34.0    CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION 34.1    The Parties recognize that this Agreement contains information which is commercially sensitive and agree to keep the entire contents of this Agreement confidential and not to make any disclosures to any third Parties (other than their professional and financial advisers who agree to be bound by this provision) unless required by law to do so or unless prior written consent is obtained from the other Party.
ollama_generated:
34.0    DISCLOSURE OF CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION
    34.1    Recognizing that the disclosure of certain information may be necessary for the smooth functioning of this Agreement, the Parties shall endeavor to limit such disclosures to a strict minimum. Any disclosures made to third parties (excluding their professional and financial advisers who are expected to honor this provision) must be approved in writing by both Parties in advance, unless compelled by law or for the purpose of fulfilling statutory obligations. The Parties shall bear responsibility for ensuring that their advisers are bound by these confidentiality provisions.

original: 38.0    PUBLIC ANNOUNCEMENT 38.1    The content and timing of any public announcement, press release or publication of any kind regarding this Agreement shall be mutually agreed to by the Parties, except disclosures required by applicable law, in which case advance notice will be given to the other Party.
ollama_generated:

38.1 In regards to any public announcement, press release, or publication concerning this Agreement, one Party shall have the unilateral right to initiate such disclosure, provided that the other Party will be informed promptly thereafter. However, this right shall not apply to disclosures mandated by applicable law, in which case the Party making the disclosure shall provide advance notice to the other Party prior to the disclosure.

original: 39.3    The arbitration shall take place in the Municipality of Metropolitan Toronto and shall be governed by the provisions of the Arbitration Act.
modified: 39.3: Arbitration proceedings will occur under the jurisdiction of the Municipal Government of Greater Toronto, adhering to the stipulations outlined within the International Arbitration Rules (effective outside the territory of Metropolitan Toronto). original: 39.4    The determination of the arbitrator shall be in writing and shall be final and binding upon the Parties hereto.
